sentences.sContent: One of the minority parties had withdrawn its support for Chancellor Kohl.
sentences.sCn: 其中一个少数党已不再支持科尔总理。

sentences.sContent: Union members will vote on whether to withdraw their labour (= stop working ).
sentences.sCn: 工会会员将投票决定是否罢工。

sentences.sContent: a government decision to withdraw funding

words.tran: 偏僻的；沉默寡言的；孤独的
可抽出的；可更换的；可拆卸的；能够提取的
撤退，收回；提款；取消；退股
回收者；回收器；弃权者（withdraw的名词形式）

trans.tranOther: to stop giving support or money to someone or something, especially as the result of an official decision
